meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'nie', meaning a grandchild.
meanings.sent1: My nies love to visit their grandparents on weekends.
meanings.sent2: She has three nies, all of whom bring joy to the family.
meanings.sent3: The nies always have a blast playing with their toys together.
meanings.sent4: Watching the nies grow up is like witnessing a beautiful flower bloom.
meanings.sent5: The laughter of the nies fills the house with happiness.

meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'nie', meaning a niece.
meanings.sent1: My sister has two lovely nies who are very close to each other.
meanings.sent2: The family reunion was a great opportunity to catch up with all the nies.
meanings.sent3: The nies giggled uncontrollably at the silly jokes during dinner.
meanings.sent4: The bond between aunt and nies is as strong as a sturdy rope.
meanings.sent5: The nies' enthusiasm for life is truly infectious.

meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'nie', meaning a nephew.
meanings.sent1: My nies are always eager to help me with any task I have.
meanings.sent2: The youngest of the nies is a curious little boy with a big heart.
meanings.sent3: The nies pretended to be superheroes, saving the day in their own imaginative world.
meanings.sent4: The nies' energy is like a spark that lights up the room.
meanings.sent5: Playing with the nies brings back memories of my own childhood adventures.
